channel.title: My new page design
channel.description:
This is the first page I've ever wholly written (including template & design) and I was looking for some feedback: www.jamesmonger.com
Thanks

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:28, topic:470932”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=588464.msg4176024#msg4176024 date=1355014722]
I did read the rest However, the script won’t be used on more than one or I would have just created a quick PHP include for it.
How would I center a certain line?

<div align="center">yo</div>?
[/quote]
I meant about the CSS, I edited that post a few times not just for cleanliness of code either, in some cases it can cause it to fail CSS validators and slow the page down (though we’re talking fractions of seconds).

And no, assign it an ID or class and set the text-align property through there.[/quote]

Ah yes, I get it now Thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:22, topic:470932”]I did read the rest However, the script won’t be used on more than one or I would have just created a quick PHP include for it.
How would I center a certain line?

I meant about the CSS, I edited that post a few times not just for cleanliness of code either, in some cases it can cause it to fail CSS validators and slow the page down (though we’re talking fractions of seconds).

And no, assign it an ID or class and set the text-align property through there.

Read full topic

[/quote]

We just went over how the use of center tags is now deprecated and all styling elements should be done through CSS, lol.

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:19, topic:470932”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=588464.msg4175614#msg4175614 date=1354975745]
My only criticism would be the use of center tags, ew. Not just an opinion either, they’re deprecated now, just a heads up

Always remember, CSS for presentation, HTML for semantics.

Oh, and if the script is going to be used more than once it should be stored in an external file in a function, then just call the function when it’s needed.
[/quote]

What should I use as center if I only want to align one piece of text?
Also, the update thing won’t be there at the end - it’s only a placeholder.[/quote]
Did you read the rest of what I wrote as well?
And yes, using either text-align or auto margins, depending on whether you’re centering the element itself or the text within the element.

Don’t take it all as bad either, sorry I forgot to write anything positive in my paragraph honestly it’s brilliant for a near beginner, much better than most, keep up the good work

Read full topic

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:19, topic:470932”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=588464.msg4175614#msg4175614 date=1354975745]
My only criticism would be the use of center tags, ew. Not just an opinion either, they’re deprecated now, just a heads up

Always remember, CSS for presentation, HTML for semantics.

Oh, and if the script is going to be used more than once it should be stored in an external file in a function, then just call the function when it’s needed.
[/quote]

What should I use as center if I only want to align one piece of text?
Also, the update thing won’t be there at the end - it’s only a placeholder.[/quote]

MDN Web Docs

text-align

The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element. text-align does not control the alignment of block elements, only their inline content.

Read full topic

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:18, topic:470932”]My only criticism would be the use of center tags, ew. Not just an opinion either, they’re deprecated now, just a heads up

Always remember, CSS for presentation, HTML for semantics.

Oh, and if the script is going to be used more than once it should be stored in an external file in a function, then just call the function when it’s needed.[/quote]

What should I use as center if I only want to align one piece of text?
Also, the update thing won’t be there at the end - it’s only a placeholder.

Read full topic

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

My only criticism would be the use of center tags, ew. Not just an opinion either, they’re deprecated now, just a heads up

Always remember, CSS for presentation, HTML for semantics.

Oh, and if the script is going to be used more than once it should be stored in an external file in a function, then just call the function when it’s needed.

Edit2: on looking at your CSS, couple of suggestions, where you declare your margins and padding, you do each side separately, for cleanliness of code you should define it in one property. e.g. margin: 10px auto 20px auto;
The order is top, right, bottom, and left respectively. See http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_margin.asp for reference, and this is the same for margins as well.
With the border-radius CSS3 property, it’s not necessary to define the prefixes for each browser anymore, it’s become a standard as just border-radius. However, the prefixes for box-shadow and most other CSS3 properties are still needed.

Also look into HTML resets for CSS.

Read full topic

item.title: My new page design
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Ruby:

I thought the whole hours since update thing was done in php, my bad :.

Date.dateDiff = function(datepart, fromdate, todate) { datepart = datepart.toLowerCase(); var diff = todate - fromdate; var divideBy = { w:604800000, d:86400000, h:3600000, n:60000, s:1000 }; return Math.floor( diff/divideBy[datepart]); } var last = new Date("December 1, 2012 00:45:00"); var today = new Date(); document.write('Hours since the last update: <strong>' + Date.dateDiff('h', last, today) + "</strong>");

Read full topic
